bug.author: dmjef
bug.summary: Command in wav2vec documentation no longer works: --criterion binary_cross_entropy is unrecognized.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
On <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/examples/wav2vec/README.md>this page</denchmark-link> , the command to pre-train wav2vec (version 1) fails because is no longer recognized. Changing that argument to fails due to a NotImplementedError - it's not obvious what to use. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run the following command, taken verbatim from the wav2vec readme, with the proper code and data setup: python train.py /manifest/path --save-dir /model/path --num-workers 6 --fp16 --max-update 400000 --save-interval 1 --no-epoch-checkpoints \ --arch wav2vec --task audio_pretraining --lr 1e-06 --min-lr 1e-09 --optimizer adam --max-lr 0.005 --lr-scheduler cosine \ --conv-feature-layers [(512, 10, 5), (512, 8, 4), (512, 4, 2), (512, 4, 2), (512, 4, 2), (512, 1, 1), (512, 1, 1)] \ --conv-aggregator-layers [(512, 2, 1), (512, 3, 1), (512, 4, 1), (512, 5, 1), (512, 6, 1), (512, 7, 1), (512, 8, 1), (512, 9, 1), (512, 10, 1), (512, 11, 1), (512, 12, 1), (512, 13, 1)] \ --skip-connections-agg --residual-scale 0.5 --log-compression --warmup-updates 500 --warmup-init-lr 1e-07 --criterion binary_cross_entropy --num-negatives 10 \ --max-sample-size 150000 --max-tokens 1500000 --skip-invalid-size-inputs-valid-test The command fails with the following error message: train.py: error: argument --criterion: invalid choice: 'binary_cross_entropy' (choose from 'legacy_masked_lm_loss', 'masked_lm', 'sentence_prediction', 'label_smoothed_cross_entropy', 'nat_loss', 'composite_loss', 'ctc', 'cross_entropy', 'adaptive_loss', 'sentence_ranking', 'wav2vec', 'label_smoothed_cross_entropy_with_alignment', 'vocab_parallel_cross_entropy') <denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
This is happening with the current version on master but not version <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/commit/cf87f759b9f09769dc416761738cee72382252df>cf87f75</denchmark-link> . So this issue was introduced with word2vec 2.0.
